sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A Carnot engine operates between two heat reservoirs, one at a temperature of 500 K and the other at a temperature of 300 K. The engine performs 1000 J of work during each cycle. What is the efficiency of the Carnot engine?
message_2:
The efficiency of a Carnot engine is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 300 K and T_hot = 500 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 500 K)
Efficiency = 1 - 0.6
Efficiency = 0.4

So, the efficiency of the Carnot engine is 40%.
